meanings.definition: The state or quality of being extremely hungry or voracious.
meanings.sent1: Her ravenousnesses was evident as she devoured the entire pizza in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The wolf's ravenousnesses was apparent as it hunted for its next meal.
meanings.sent3: His ravenousnesses for knowledge led him to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent4: The ravenousnesses of the fire consumed everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The ravenousnesses of the storm left a trail of destruction behind.

meanings.definition: The act of consuming food in large quantities due to extreme hunger.
meanings.sent1: After days of fasting, his ravenousnesses at the buffet surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The bear's ravenousnesses after hibernation led it to raid campsites for food.
meanings.sent3: The ravenousnesses of the toddler at the birthday party was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The ravenousnesses of the crowd at the food festival emptied all the stalls in no time.
meanings.sent5: The ravenousnesses of the marathon runners was satisfied with a hearty meal after the race.

meanings.definition: A strong desire or craving for something.
meanings.sent1: Her ravenousnesses for adventure took her to far-off lands.
meanings.sent2: The artist's ravenousnesses for perfection drove him to work tirelessly on his masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: His ravenousnesses for success pushed him to work late into the night.
meanings.sent4: The ravenousnesses for change in the community sparked a movement.
meanings.sent5: The ravenousnesses for knowledge led to a thirst for learning in the classroom.
